events.originalText: Pakistani prime minister Imran Khan inaugurated the Kartarpur Corridor, a visa-free border crossing connecting the Gurdwara Darbar Sahib to the Indian border.
events.subtitle: Imran Khan
events.headline: Imran Khan Inaugurates Kartarpur Corridor

events.originalText: A tram derailment in Croydon, London, killed seven people.
events.subtitle: 2016 Croydon tram derailment
events.headline: Tram Derailment in Croydon Kills Seven

events.originalText: Bosnian War: Croatian Defence Council forces destroyed the Stari Most, a 16th-century bridge crossing the river Neretva in the city of Mostar (rebuilt bridge pictured).
events.subtitle: Bosnian War
events.headline: Bosnian War: Stari Most Bridge Destroyed

events.originalText: East German official Günter Schabowski mistakenly announced the immediate opening of the inner German border, resulting in the fall of the Berlin Wall that night.
events.subtitle: Günter Schabowski
events.headline: Günter Schabowski's Mistake Leads to Fall of Berlin Wall

events.originalText: The first issue of Rolling Stone, an American magazine focusing on music, politics and popular culture, was published.
events.subtitle: Rolling Stone
events.headline: Rolling Stone Magazine's First Issue Published

events.originalText: World War II: A covert Sicherheitsdienst operation captured two British Secret Intelligence Service agents near Venlo in the Netherlands.
events.subtitle: World War II
events.headline: WWII: British Agents Captured Near Venlo

events.originalText: Kristallnacht began as SA stormtroopers and civilians destroyed and ransacked Jewish homes, businesses and synagogues in Germany and Austria, resulting in at least 90 deaths and the deportation of 30,000 men to concentration camps.
events.subtitle: Kristallnacht
events.headline: Kristallnacht: Attacks on Jewish Homes and Synagogues

events.originalText: The government of the Azerbaijan Democratic Republic adopted a tricolour national flag (pictured) that remains in use today with slight modifications by the present-day Republic of Azerbaijan.
events.subtitle: Azerbaijan Democratic Republic
events.headline: Azerbaijan Adopts Tricolour National Flag

events.originalText: World War I: Off the Cocos (Keeling) Islands, the Australian light cruiser Sydney sank Emden, the last active German warship in the Indian Ocean.
events.subtitle: World War I
events.headline: WWI: Australian Cruiser Sinks Last German Warship

events.originalText: A severe blizzard reached its maximum intensity in the Great Lakes Basin of North America, destroying 19 ships and 68,300 tons of cargo, and killing more than 250 people.
events.subtitle: Great Lakes Storm of 1913
events.headline: Great Lakes Blizzard Kills Over 250 People

events.originalText: Mary Jane Kelly, widely believed to be the fifth and final victim of the notorious unidentified serial killer Jack the Ripper, was murdered in London.
events.subtitle: Mary Jane Kelly
events.headline: Jack the Ripper's Final Victim Murdered in London

events.originalText: USS Alligator engaged three pirate schooners off the coast of Cuba in one of the West Indies anti-piracy operations of the United States.
events.subtitle: USS Alligator (1820)
events.headline: USS Alligator Engages Pirate Schooners off Cuba
